title: Cell Structure and Function

vocab.definition: The basic unit of life that makes up all living things
The control center of a cell that contains DNA
The jelly-like substance inside a cell where chemical reactions occur
The thin barrier that controls what enters and leaves a cell
A specialized structure inside a cell that performs specific functions

teachingNotes: Use microscope images and cell diagrams. Compare plant and animal cells. Emphasize that cells are the building blocks of all life.

sample.question: What is the basic unit of life?

truefalse.question: The nucleus controls what the cell does.

multiplechoice.question: What controls what enters and leaves a cell?

fillintheblank.question: The jelly-like substance inside a cell is called ________.

shortanswer.question: What is the difference between plant and animal cells?
